title: The Battle Hymn
summary:
Key ideas
- American patriotic songs often have many verses
- There is a rarely sung sixth verse to Battle Hymn of the Republic
- The Battle Hymn has an interesting history with various adaptations and parodies

Key learnings
- The evolution of the Battle Hymn from a standard spiritual to a widely recognized patriotic song shows the concept of adaptive fitness
- Songs can have secret or excluded parts

Key questions
- What is the meaning of the rarely-sung sixth verse to Battle Hymn of the Republic?
- What was the process of adapting and dignifying the tune of the Battle Hymn?
- How did the Battle Hymn gain such widespread recognition and become a part of American culture?
